dsls.markdown: # Going Places Safely The Internet is a powerful, but sometimes dangerous place. Stay safe while navigating the Internet!

# Happy Maps

Create an algorithm to move a character through a maze.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s.short_instructions: For this puzzle, snap the blocks together and press "▶ Run"!
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s.long_instructions: To get Scrat to the acorn, snap the [blockly block][0] block to the bottom of the [blockly block][1] block, then press "▶ Run"!

authored_hints.1: If Scrat isn't doing what you want, make sure both of the blocks have been fully clicked together, then click "Run" again.
authored_hints.2: Don't be afraid to make a mistake! Try something, and if it doesn't work, try something else!

callouts.grade2_CaringForNewPet_0_1: After connecting all the blocks, press "Run" to start your program.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s.short_instructions: Snap all blocks together to finish your code, then click "▶ Run".
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s.long_instructions: Snap both [blockly block][0] blocks to the bottom of the [blockly block][1] block to finish your code, then click "▶ Run".

dsls.markdown:
# Happy Loops

In this lesson, you will learn about loops!

![](https://images.code.org/6aac7f675f0c69033f42ccac6a733f68-image-1557769673400.png)

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s.short_instructions: Help Scrat across the ice to get to the acorn!
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s.long_instructions: Help Scrat across the slippery ice to get to the acorn!

authored_hints.courseB_iceage_loops1_a: Watch out for broken ice! Scrat will fall right through!
authored_hints.courseB_iceage_loops1_b:
You will have to use this block:

[blockly block][0]

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s.short_instructions: Use two different move blocks to get to the acorn!
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s.long_instructions: Use both [blockly block][0] and [blockly block][1] blocks to get to the acorn!

authored_hints.courseB_iceage_loops2_a: Break this puzzle into two pieces, one before the corner, and one after the corner.
authored_hints.courseB_iceage_loops2_b: If you get stuck, try saying the steps out loud.
authored_hints.courseB_iceage_loops2_c: Follow this path to get Scrat to the acorn.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s.short_instructions: Can you get to the acorn with just one `W` block?
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s.long_instructions: Can you get to the acorn with just one [blockly block][0] block? Try using a loop!

authored_hints.courseB_iceage_loops3_b: To repeat code, drag out a `repeat` [blockly block][0]loop, then put the block you want inside of it.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s.short_instructions: Add one more block to get Scrat all the way to the acorn!
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s.long_instructions: Add one more block to get Scrat all the way to the acorn!

authored_hints.courseB_iceage_loops4_a: Try writing down the steps Scrat would take to get to the acorn. Do you see a pattern?
authored_hints.courseB_iceage_loops4_b: Don't be afraid to run your code and see what happens!
authored_hints.courseB_iceage_loops4_c: This is the path Scrat should take.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s.short_instructions: Can you add a loop to get to the acorn?
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s.long_instructions: Can you add a loop to get to the acorn?

authored_hints.courseB_iceage_loops6_a: Your final code will have **three** movement blocks.
authored_hints.courseB_iceage_loops6_b: You only need to add **one** more loop!
authored_hints.courseB_iceage_loops6_c: Your final path should look like this.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s.short_instructions: Scrat really wants that acorn!
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s.long_instructions: Scrat really wants that acorn!

authored_hints.courseB_iceage_loops7_a: If you get stuck, try writing steps down on a piece of paper. Do you see a pattern?
authored_hints.courseB_iceage_loops7_b: This is the path Scrat should take to get to the acorn.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s.short_instructions: Can you fix this code?
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s.long_instructions: Can you fix this code?

authored_hints.courseB_iceage_loops8_a: Are the movement blocks right? What else can you change?
authored_hints.courseB_iceage_loops8_b: The first loop should repeat **3** times, the second should repeat **5** times, the third loop should repeat **4** times, and the last loop should repeat **4** times.
authored_hints.courseB_iceage_loops8_c: Use loops to help Scrat follow this path.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s.short_instructions: The acorn is so far away! Can you use loops to help Scrat get there?
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s.long_instructions: The acorn is so far away! Can you use loops to help Scrat get there?

authored_hints.courseB_iceage_loops9_a: Having trouble? Try breaking this puzzle into smaller pieces. Don't be afraid to run your puzzle as you code!
authored_hints.courseB_iceage_loops9_b: Your final code should have **4** loops.
authored_hints.courseB_iceage_loops9_c: Scrat should follow this path to get the acorn.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s.short_instructions: Help Scrat get all the way over to the acorn!
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s.long_instructions: Help Scrat get all the way over to the acorn!

authored_hints.courseB_iceage_loops10_a: Watch out for broken ice! Scrat will fall into the water!
authored_hints.courseB_iceage_loops10_b: Try saying the steps out loud or writing them down on a piece of paper. Do you see any patterns?
authored_hints.courseB_iceage_loops10_c: This is a long puzzle! Follow this path.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s.long_instructions: Help Scrat get to the acorn!

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s.short_instructions: Get to the acorn any way you can!
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s.long_instructions: Get to the acorn any way you can!

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s.short_instructions: Move Laurel around and get as much treasure as you can!
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s.long_instructions:
**Free Play:** This is Laurel the Adventurer! Move her around and get as much treasure as you can.

Drag blocks into the workspace and try to figure out how to get treasure.  Get at least one item to pass this level.

authored_hints.courseA_collector_loops1_a:
After you have moved to a square with treasure, use this block to pick it up.

[blockly block][0]
authored_hints.courseA_collector_loops1_b: A simple solution would be to move East 2 times, then get the treasure.

callouts.courseA_collector_loops1_1: Use this block to collect the treasure.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s.short_instructions: Get all three piles! Move Laurel to each piece of treasure, then use the collect block.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s.long_instructions: Get all three piles! Move Laurel to each piece of treasure, then use the [blockly block][0] block.

authored_hints.courseA_collector_loops2_a: You'll have to move before you can collect any treasure.
authored_hints.courseA_collector_loops2_b:
After you have moved to a square with treasure, use this block to pick it up.

[blockly block][0]

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s.long_instructions: How can Laurel get all five piles of treasure using only one [blockly block][0] block?

authored_hints.courseA_collector_loops3_b: Remember, you can put more than 1 block inside a [blockly block][0] loop.

callouts.gradek_adventurer_loops2_1: This number tells you how many of these blocks you can use in this puzzle.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s.short_instructions: Fix Laurel's path to get all of this treasure.

authored_hints.courseA_collector_loops4_a: To change how far Laurel goes, change the number of times that the loop runs.
authored_hints.courseA_collector_loops4_b: Don't forget that Laurel needs to walk down and collect the treasure after she finishes the [blockly block][0] loop!

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s.short_instructions: Use what you learned to get all of the treasure.

authored_hints.courseA_collector_loops5_a: If you can't figure out the answer right away, try using a piece of paper to figure out what arrows you will need and look for a pattern.
authored_hints.courseA_collector_loops5_b: Try splitting the problem into 2 parts, moving sideways and then down.
authored_hints.courseA_collector_loops5_c: You'll want to start with a [blockly block][0] loop that moves Laurel west and collects treasure.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s.short_instructions: Add blocks to this code to get all of the treasure.

authored_hints.courseA_collector_loops6_a: Can't figure out what's wrong? Try running the code a couple of times to see what happens.
authored_hints.courseA_collector_loops6_b: The shortest solution has 2 [blockly block][0] loops, one after the other.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s.short_instructions: What should you add to this code to get all of the treasure?

authored_hints.courseA_collector_loops7_a: If you can't figure out what comes next, try running the code to see where Laurel ends up.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s.short_instructions: Write code to get all of this treasure.

authored_hints.courseA_collector_loops8_a: If you are having trouble figuring this puzzle out, try writing the moves down on a piece of paper and looking for a pattern.
authored_hints.courseA_collector_loops8_b: Try breaking this puzzle into 3 separate problems, and writing loops for each.
authored_hints.courseA_collector_loops8_c: Remember you can write one piece of the code at a time, then press "Run" to figure out where you need to go from there.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s.short_instructions: **Challenge:** The treasure goes all the way up these stairs!  Write the code to help Laurel get it all.

authored_hints.courseA_collector_loops9_a: If you can't spot the best places to use loops, try coding it out step-by-step and look for a pattern.
authored_hints.courseA_collector_loops9_b: Try putting 2 of your [blockly block][0] loops inside of another loop to make your code shorter!

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s.short_instructions: Help Laurel get all of the treasure along this path.
Help Laurel get all of the treasure from this cave.
_"Eureka!  Get as much treasure as you can!"_
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s.long_instructions:
_"Eureka!  Get as much treasure as you can!"_\
(You do not have to get it all.)

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s.short_instructions: Collect at least **3** pieces of treasure to pass this level.

authored_hints.courseA_collector_loops_challenge2kp_b: Try this path to get you to a solution.
authored_hints.courseA_collector_loops_challenge2kp_a: Can you use loops to solve this puzzle?

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s.short_instructions: _"Can you help me spot some bugs?"_
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s.long_instructions: _"Can you help me spot some bugs? I know which way I want to go, but I'm not sure how many steps to take."_

authored_hints.courseA_collector_loops_challenge1_a: Try changing the numbers in each loop if something seems wrong.
authored_hints.courseA_collector_loops_challenge1_b: You don't need to use a loop if you are only doing something one time.
authored_hints.courseA_collector_loops_challenge1_c: There are 6 gems on the right side of the cave when you start, but you only need to get treasure 5 times moving South. Do you know why?
authored_hints.courseA_collector_loops_challenge1_d:
The starting program doesn't collect the last 2 gems. Try adding this code at the very end:

[blockly block][0]

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s.short_instructions: This is a new type of puzzle called "Artist". Play with the level and draw something fun.
Help the artist draw this line two times forward.

Help the artist draw this line two times forward.

[][0]

authored_hints.courseA_artist_loops2_a: Can't figure out how to draw a line?  Start attaching blocks to the [blockly block][0] block to see what happens.
authored_hints.courseA_artist_loops2_b: Use this block [blockly block][0] to solve this puzzle.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s.short_instructions: Draw a line forward five times.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s.long_instructions:
Our artist is trying to draw a line five times, but can't get it right. Can you help?

[expandable][0]

authored_hints.courseA_artist_loops3_a: Trace slowly through the program with your finger to see where it goes wrong.
authored_hints.courseA_artist_loops3_b:

dsls.markdown:
# The Big Event

In computer science, events are actions that a computer monitors. In this lesson you will react differently depending on which button is pressed.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s.short_instructions: Need a better playlab/events combo
This is a Play Lab level. Move blocks to the workspace and see what happens!
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s.long_instructions: This is a Play Lab level. Move blocks to the workspace and see what happens!

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s.short_instructions: Jorge the Dog wants to say "Hi there." Can you help him?
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s.long_instructions: Jorge the Dog wants to say "Hi there." Can you help him?

Help Jorge the Dog get moving by connecting the [blockly block][0] block to the [blockly block][1] event block that is already in the workspace.

Get Jorge to the flag to finish this level!
